Package: com.android.builder.core

[Java] Class VariantConfiguration<T, D, F>

    • com.android.builder.core.VariantConfiguration

    • A Variant configuration. Variants are made from the combination of: - a build type (base interface BuildType), and its associated sources. - a default configuration (base interface ProductFlavor), and its associated sources. - a optional list of product flavors (base interface ProductFlavor) and their associated sources. - dependencies (both jar and aar).

      Parameters:
      - the type used for the Build Type.
      - the type used for the default config
      - the type used for the product flavors.

      • Constructor Summary

          Constructors 
          Constructor and description
          VariantConfiguration (D defaultConfig, com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider defaultSourceProvider, T buildType, com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider buildTypeSourceProvider, VariantType type, com.android.builder.model.SigningConfig signingConfigOverride)
          Creates the configuration with the base source sets for a given VariantType.
          VariantConfiguration (D defaultConfig, com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider defaultSourceProvider, T buildType, com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider buildTypeSourceProvider, VariantType type, VariantConfiguration testedConfig, com.android.builder.model.SigningConfig signingConfigOverride)
          Creates the configuration with the base source sets, and an optional tested variant.

      • Constructor Detail

        • public VariantConfiguration(@com.android.annotations.NonNull D defaultConfig, @com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider defaultSourceProvider, @com.android.annotations.NonNull T buildType, @com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider buildTypeSourceProvider, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantType type, @com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SigningConfig signingConfigOverride)

          Creates the configuration with the base source sets for a given VariantType. Meant for non-testing variants.

          Parameters:
          defaultConfig - the default configuration. Required.
          defaultSourceProvider - the default source provider. Required
          buildType - the build type for this variant. Required.
          buildTypeSourceProvider - the source provider for the build type.
          type - the type of the project.
          signingConfigOverride - an optional Signing override to be used for signing.

        • public VariantConfiguration(@com.android.annotations.NonNull D defaultConfig, @com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider defaultSourceProvider, @com.android.annotations.NonNull T buildType, @com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider buildTypeSourceProvider, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantType type, @com.android.annotations.Nullable VariantConfiguration testedConfig, @com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SigningConfig signingConfigOverride)

          Creates the configuration with the base source sets, and an optional tested variant.

          Parameters:
          defaultConfig - the default configuration. Required.
          defaultSourceProvider - the default source provider. Required
          buildType - the build type for this variant. Required.
          buildTypeSourceProvider - the source provider for the build type.
          type - the type of the project.
          testedConfig - the reference to the tested project. Required if type is Type.ANDROID_TEST
          signingConfigOverride - an optional Signing override to be used for signing.

      • Method Detail

        • public void addBuildConfigField(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String type, @com.android.annotations.NonNull String name, @com.android.annotations.NonNull String value)

          Adds a variant-specific BuildConfig field.

          Parameters:
          type - the type of the field
          name - the name of the field
          value - the value of the field

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public VariantConfiguration addProductFlavor(@com.android.annotations.NonNull F productFlavor, @com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider sourceProvider, @com.android.annotations.NonNull String dimensionName)

          Add a new configured ProductFlavor. If multiple flavors are added, the priority follows the order they are added when it comes to resolving Android resources overlays (ie earlier added flavors supersedes latter added ones).

          Parameters:
          productFlavor - the configured product flavor
          sourceProvider - the source provider for the product flavor
          dimensionName - the name of the dimension associated with the flavor
          Returns:
          the config object

        • public void addResValue(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String type, @com.android.annotations.NonNull String name, @com.android.annotations.NonNull String value)

          Adds a variant-specific res value.

          Parameters:
          type - the type of the field
          name - the name of the field
          value - the value of the field

        • public void checkSourceProviders()

          Checks the SourceProviders to ensure that they don't use the same folders. This can't be allowed as it can break incremental support, or generate dup files in resulting APK.

          throws:
          java.lang.RuntimeException if a dup is found.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String computeBaseNameWithSplits(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String splitName)

          Returns a base name that includes the given splits name.

          Parameters:
          splitName - the split name
          Returns:
          a unique name made up of the variant and split names.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String computeDirNameWithSplits(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String... splitNames)

          Returns a unique directory name (can include multiple folders) for the variant, based on build type, flavor and test, and splits.

          This always uses forward slashes ('/') as separator on all platform.

          Returns:
          the directory name for the variant

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String computeFullNameWithSplits(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String splitName)

          Returns a full name that includes the given splits name.

          Parameters:
          splitName - the split name
          Returns:
          a unique name made up of the variant and split names.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getAidlImports()

          Returns all the aidl import folder that are outside of the current project.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getAidlSourceList()

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<LibraryDependency> getAllLibraries()

          Returns all the library dependencies, direct and transitive.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getApplicationId()

          Returns the application ID for this variant. This could be coming from the manifest or could be overridden through the product flavors and/or the build type.

          Returns:
          the application ID

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<com.android.ide.common.res2.AssetSet> getAssetSets(@com.android.annotations.NonNull List<File> generatedResFolders, boolean includeDependencies)

          Returns the dynamic list of com.android.ide.common.res2.AssetSet based on the configuration, its dependencies, as well as tested config if applicable (test of a library). The list is ordered in ascending order of importance, meaning the first set is meant to be overridden by the 2nd one and so on. This is meant to facilitate usage of the list in a com.android.ide.common.res2.AssetMerger.

          Returns:
          a list ResourceSet.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getBaseName()

          Returns the full, unique name of the variant, including BuildType, flavors and test, dash separated. (similar to full name but with dashes)

          Returns:
          the name of the variant

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<Object> getBuildConfigItems()

          Returns a list of items for the BuildConfig class. Items can be either fields (instance of com.android.builder.model.ClassField) or comments (instance of String).

          Returns:
          a list of items.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public T getBuildType()

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider getBuildTypeSourceSet()

          The SourceProvider for the BuildType. Can be null.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Set<File> getCompileClasspath()

          Returns the compile classpath for this config. If the config tests a library, this will include the classpath of the tested config

          Returns:
          a non null, but possibly empty set.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getDirName()

          Returns a unique directory name (can include multiple folders) for the variant, based on build type, flavor and test.

          This always uses forward slashes ('/') as separator on all platform.

          Returns:
          the directory name for the variant

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<LibraryDependency> getDirectLibraries()

          Returns the direct library dependencies

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Collection<JarDependency> getExternalJarDependencies()

          Returns the list of external/module jar dependencies

          Returns:
          a non null collection of Jar dependencies.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getFlavorName()

          Returns the flavor name of the variant, including all flavors in camel case (starting with a lower case). If the variant has no flavor, then an empty string is returned.

          Returns:
          the flavor name or an empty string.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<String> getFlavorNamesWithDimensionNames()

          Return the names of the applied flavors. The list contains the dimension names as well.

          Returns:
          the list, possibly empty if there are no flavors.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider> getFlavorSourceProviders()

          Returns the list of SourceProviders for the flavors. The list is ordered from higher priority to lower priority.

          Returns:
          the list of Source Providers for the flavors. Never null.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getFullName()

          Returns the full, unique name of the variant in camel case (starting with a lower case), including BuildType, Flavors and Test (if applicable).

          Returns:
          the name of the variant

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Boolean getFunctionalTest()

          Returns functionalTest value to use to test this variant, or if the variant is a test, the one to use to test the tested variant.

          Returns:
          the functionalTest value

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Boolean getHandleProfiling()

          Returns handleProfiling value to use to test this variant, or if the variant is a test, the one to use to test the tested variant.

          Returns:
          the handleProfiling value

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public String getIdOverride()

          Returns the application id override value coming from the Product Flavor and/or the Build Type. If the package/id is not overridden then this returns null.

          Returns:
          the id override or null

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public String getInstrumentationRunner()

          Returns the instrumentationRunner to use to test this variant, or if the variant is a test, the one to use to test the tested variant.

          Returns:
          the instrumentation test runner name

          Parses the manifest file and return the package name.

          Parameters:
          manifestFile - the manifest file
          Returns:
          the package name found or null

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Map<String, Object> getManifestPlaceholders()

          Returns the merged manifest placeholders. All product flavors are merged first, then build type specific placeholders are added and potentially overrides product flavors values.

          Returns:
          the merged manifest placeholders for a build variant.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Map<String, com.android.builder.model.ClassField> getMergedBuildConfigFields()

          Return the merged build config fields for the variant. This is made of of the variant-specific fields overlayed on top of the build type ones, the flavors ones, and the default config ones.

          Returns:
          a map of merged fields

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public com.android.builder.model.ProductFlavor getMergedFlavor()

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Map<String, com.android.builder.model.ClassField> getMergedResValues()

          Return the merged res values for the variant. This is made of of the variant-specific fields overlayed on top of the build type ones, the flavors ones, and the default config ones.

          Returns:
          a map of merged fields

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public com.android.builder.model.ApiVersion getMinSdkVersion()

          Return the minSdkVersion for this variant. This uses both the value from the manifest (if present), and the override coming from the flavor(s) (if present).

          Returns:
          the minSdkVersion

        • public File getMultiDexKeepProguard()

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider getMultiFlavorSourceProvider()

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public String getOriginalApplicationId()

          Returns the original application ID before any overrides from flavors. If the variant is a test variant, then the application ID is the one coming from the configuration of the tested variant, and this call is similar to getApplicationId()

          Returns:
          the original application ID

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public String getPackageFromManifest()

          Reads the package name from the manifest. This is unmodified by the build type.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Set<File> getPackagedJars()

          Returns the list of packaged jars for this config. If the config tests a library, this will include the jars of the tested config

          Returns:
          a non null, but possibly empty list.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<F> getProductFlavors()

          Returns the product flavors. Items earlier in the list override later items.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getProguardFiles(boolean includeLibraries, List<File> defaultProguardConfig)

          Returns the proguard config files coming from the project but also from the dependencies. Note that if the method is set to include config files coming from libraries, they will only be included if the aars have already been unzipped.

          Parameters:
          includeLibraries - whether to include the library dependencies.
          Returns:
          a non null list of proguard files.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getProvidedOnlyJars()

          Returns the list of provided-only jars for this config.

          Returns:
          a non null, but possibly empty list.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getRenderscriptImports()

          Returns all the renderscript import folder that are outside of the current project.

        • public boolean getRenderscriptNdkModeEnabled()

          Returns the renderscript NDK mode.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<File> getRenderscriptSourceList()

          Returns all the renderscript source folder from the main config, the flavors and the build type.

          Returns:
          a list of folders.

        • public boolean getRenderscriptSupportModeEnabled()

          Returns the renderscript support mode.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<Object> getResValues()

          Returns a list of generated resource values. Items can be either fields (instance of com.android.builder.model.ClassField) or comments (instance of String).

          Returns:
          a list of items.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<com.android.ide.common.res2.ResourceSet> getResourceSets(@com.android.annotations.NonNull List<File> generatedResFolders, boolean includeDependencies)

          Returns the dynamic list of com.android.ide.common.res2.ResourceSet based on the configuration, its dependencies, as well as tested config if applicable (test of a library). The list is ordered in ascending order of importance, meaning the first set is meant to be overridden by the 2nd one and so on. This is meant to facilitate usage of the list in a com.android.ide.common.res2.ResourceMerger.

          Parameters:
          generatedResFolders - a list of generated res folders
          includeDependencies - whether to include in the result the resources of the dependencies
          Returns:
          a list ResourceSet.

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public com.android.builder.model.SigningConfig getSigningConfig()

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public List<com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider> getSortedSourceProviders()

          Returns a list of sorted SourceProvider in order of ascending order, meaning, the earlier items are meant to be overridden by later items.

          Returns:
          a list of source provider

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public com.android.builder.model.ApiVersion getTargetSdkVersion()

          Return the targetSdkVersion for this variant. This uses both the value from the manifest (if present), and the override coming from the flavor(s) (if present).

          Returns:
          the targetSdkVersion

          Returns the variant specific source provider

          Returns:
          the source provider or null if none has been provided.

        • public int getVersionCode()

          Returns the version code for this variant. This could be coming from the manifest or could be overridden through the product flavors, and can have a suffix specified by the build type.

          Returns:
          the version code or -1 if there was non defined.

        • public int getVersionCodeFromManifest()

          Reads the version code from the manifest.

          Returns:

        • public VariantConfiguration setMultiFlavorSourceProvider(@com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider sourceProvider)

          Sets the variant-specific source provider.

          Parameters:
          sourceProvider - the source provider for the product flavor
          Returns:
          the config object

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public VariantConfiguration setOutput(LibraryDependency output)

          Sets the output of this variant. This is required when the variant is a library so that the variant that tests this library can properly include the tested library in its own package.

          Parameters:
          output - the output of the library as an LibraryDependency that will provides the location of all the created items.
          Returns:
          the config object

        • public VariantConfiguration setVariantSourceProvider(@com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.builder.model.SourceProvider sourceProvider)

          Sets the variant-specific source provider.

          Parameters:
          sourceProvider - the source provider for the product flavor
          Returns:
          the config object
